content.p: stands for Object Oriented Opensource Middleware for Service Communication Inspection and Discovery.
has been implemented so far in C++, Java and Tcl. See the download page to obtain the desired release. Services developed using any of the implementation can seemlessly interoperate together.
is born in the PRIMA project from INRIA Rhône-Alpes.
It is release under a non-sticky opensource licence: see the licence page for details.

is also known as:
Omiscid for short use (in APIs for example)
BIP because before having its name, we used to call it as its underlying protocol (Basic Interconnection Protocol).
